text: Ystrad Aeron is a small village west of Felinfach on the A482 between Lampeter and Aberaeron, Ceredigion, Wales. It has one pub, a church, a garage and a caravan park. One pub, the Vale of Aeron, was reportedly a favourite watering hole of Dylan Thomas when he lived in nearby Talsarn in the 1940s.Thomas, David N: Dylan Thomas: A Farm, Two Mansions and a Bungalow Seren 2000. The other, the Brynog Arms, which is now closed, pictured at lower right, reopened as a café and public house in 2015.Brynog Arms (photograph) at Geograph.org.uk The old railway branch to Aberaeron ran through the villages; its station was at first named Ystrad and later Felin Fach. The station closed in 1951 and the line in 1973. ==References== ==External links== *www.geograph.co.uk : photos of Ystrad Aeron and surrounding area *Brynog Arms : Cafe & Pub Ystrad Aeron Category:Villages in Ceredigion
